meanings.definition: To engage in a noisy quarrel or fight.
meanings.sent1: The siblings would outbrawl over who got to play with the toy first.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors would often outbrawl late into the night, disturbing everyone.
meanings.sent3: The two puppies would outbrawl playfully over a chew toy.
meanings.sent4: The fans at the sports game seemed to outbrawl each other in excitement.
meanings.sent5: The children would outbrawl in the playground, their voices echoing across the park.

meanings.definition: To surpass in brawling or fighting.
meanings.sent1: Despite his size, the tiny kitten could outbrawl the other cats in the alley.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer was known to outbrawl all his opponents with ease.
meanings.sent3: The ninja outbrawled all his enemies in the video game, showing his skills.
meanings.sent4: The superhero outbrawled the villains, always emerging victorious in the end.
meanings.sent5: The knight outbrawled the dragon, proving his bravery and strength.
